MemberSignature.Value: public void BindSourceToAuxiliarySlot (int source, int slot, int slotnumber, int filter);
.method public hidebysig instance void BindSourceToAuxiliarySlot(int32 source, int32 slot, int32 slotnumber, int32 filter) cil managed

Docs.param: The Source handle who's output is forwarded.
The Auxiliary Effect Slot handle that receives input from the Source.
Every Source has only a limited number of slots it can feed buffer to. The number must stay below AlcContextAttributes.EfxMaxAuxiliarySends
Filter handle to be attached between Source ouput and Auxiliary Slot input. Use 0 or EfxFilterType.FilterNull for no filter.
Docs.summary: (Helper) Reroutes a Source's output into an Auxiliary Effect Slot.

MemberSignature.Value: public void BindSourceToAuxiliarySlot (uint source, uint slot, int slotnumber, uint filter);
.method public hidebysig instance void BindSourceToAuxiliarySlot(unsigned int32 source, unsigned int32 slot, int32 slotnumber, unsigned int32 filter) cil managed

Docs.param: The Source handle who's output is forwarded.
The Auxiliary Effect Slot handle that receives input from the Source.
Every Source has only a limited number of slots it can feed buffer to. The number must stay below AlcContextAttributes.EfxMaxAuxiliarySends
Filter handle to be attached between Source ouput and Auxiliary Slot input. Use 0 or EfxFilterType.FilterNull for no filter.
Docs.summary: (Helper) Reroutes a Source's output into an Auxiliary Effect Slot.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GenAuxiliaryEffectSlot ();
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GenAuxiliaryEffectSlot() cil managed

Docs.summary: This function generates only one Auxiliary Effect Slot.
Docs.returns: Storage Int32 for the new auxiliary effect slot name/handle.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GenAuxiliaryEffectSlot (out uint slot);
.method public hidebysig instance void GenAuxiliaryEffectSlot(unsigned int32 slot) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: This function generates only one Auxiliary Effect Slot.

MemberSignature.Value: public int[] GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots (int n);
.method public hidebysig instance int32[] GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots(int32 n) cil managed

Docs.param: Number of Auxiliary Effect Slots to be created.
Docs.summary: The GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots function is used to create one or more Auxiliary Effect Slots. The number of slots that can be created will be dependant upon the Open AL device used.
Docs.returns: Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect Slot object identifiers.
Docs.remarks: An application should check the OpenAL error state after making this call to determine if the Effect Slot was successfully created. If the function call fails then none of the requested Effect Slots are created. A good strategy for creating any OpenAL object is to use a for-loop and generate one object each loop iteration and then check for an error condition. If an error is set then the loop can be broken and the application can determine if sufficient resources are available.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots (int n, out int slots);
.method public hidebysig instance void GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots(int32 n, int32 slots) cil managed

Docs.param: Number of Auxiliary Effect Slots to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect Slot object identifiers.
Docs.summary: The GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots function is used to create one or more Auxiliary Effect Slots. The number of slots that can be created will be dependant upon the Open AL device used.
Docs.remarks: An application should check the OpenAL error state after making this call to determine if the Effect Slot was successfully created. If the function call fails then none of the requested Effect Slots are created. A good strategy for creating any OpenAL object is to use a for-loop and generate one object each loop iteration and then check for an error condition. If an error is set then the loop can be broken and the application can determine if sufficient resources are available.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots (int n, out uint slots);
.method public hidebysig instance void GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots(int32 n, unsigned int32 slots) cil managed

Docs.param: Number of Auxiliary Effect Slots to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect Slot object identifiers.
Docs.summary: The GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots function is used to create one or more Auxiliary Effect Slots. The number of slots that can be created will be dependant upon the Open AL device used.
Docs.remarks: An application should check the OpenAL error state after making this call to determine if the Effect Slot was successfully created. If the function call fails then none of the requested Effect Slots are created. A good strategy for creating any OpenAL object is to use a for-loop and generate one object each loop iteration and then check for an error condition. If an error is set then the loop can be broken and the application can determine if sufficient resources are available.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GenEffect ();
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GenEffect() cil managed

Docs.summary: Generates a single effect object.
Docs.returns: A handle to the generated effect object.

remarks.para: The GenEffects function is used to create one or more Effect objects. An Effect object stores an effect type and a set of parameter values to control that Effect. In order to use an Effect it must be attached to an Auxiliary Effect Slot object.

After creation an Effect has no type (EfxEffectType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of effect should be stored in the object, using Effect() with EfxEffecti.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GenEffect (out uint effect);
.method public hidebysig instance void GenEffect(unsigned int32 effect) cil managed

Docs.param: A handle to the generated effect object.
Docs.summary: Generates a single effect object.

.method public hidebysig instance int32[] GenEffects(int32 n) cil managed

Docs.param: Number of Effect object identifiers to generate.
Docs.summary: Generates one or more effect objects.

remarks.para: The GenEffects function is used to create one or more Effect objects. An Effect object stores an effect type and a set of parameter values to control that Effect. In order to use an Effect it must be attached to an Auxiliary Effect Slot object.

After creation an Effect has no type (EfxEffectType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of effect should be stored in the object, using Effect() with EfxEffecti.

Docs.param: Number of Filters to be created.
Docs.summary: The GenFilters function is used to create one or more Filter objects. A Filter object stores a filter type and a set of parameter values to control that Filter. Filter objects can be attached to Sources as Direct Filters or Auxiliary Send Filters.
Docs.returns: Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Filter object identifiers.
Docs.remarks: After creation a Filter has no type (EfxFilterType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of filter should be stored in the object, using Filter() with EfxFilteri.

Docs.remarks: After creation a Filter has no type (EfxFilterType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of filter should be stored in the object, using Filter() with EfxFilteri.
